name.description: Name of marklogic instances as seen in DC/OS.

cpus.description: Number of logical cores to allocate to each service instance.

mem.description: Memory in Mb to allocate to each service instance.

placement.description: Constraints control where apps run to allow optimizing for either fault tolerance (by spreading a task out on multiple nodes) or locality (by running all of an applications tasks on the same node).

constraints.description: Constraints have three parts: a field name, an operator, and an optional parameter. The field can be the hostname of the agent node or any attribute of the agent node. Example: [["rack_id", "LIKE", "rack-foo-.*"], ["rack_id", "MAX_PER", "2"]]

region.description: All application nodes will run in this region. When no region is specified the nodes are constrained to the local region.

networking.description: Configure the networking for your service.

service_endpoint_01.description: DC/OS can automatically generate a Service Address to connect to each of your load balanced endpoints.

protocol.description: Protocol can be UDP, TCP or both. i.e. : "udp", "tcp", "udp, tcp". Most services will use TCP

load_balance_port.description: This port will be used to load balance this service address internally

backup_volume.description: A volume for bakcup. By default, the volume type is host. If you enter a host path in the local_persistant_volume section, the volume type will be local persistant

local_persistant_volume.description: A locally persistent volume based upon the physical disks installed in the agent which has the capabilities of a single disk.

container_path.description: The path where your application will read and write data. This must be a single-level path relative to the container ; it cannot contain a forward slash.

size_MiB.description: The size of the persistent volume in MiBs.

type.description: The type of mesos disk resource to use; the valid options are root, path, and mount, corresponding to the valid mesos multi-disk resource types.

constraints.description: Constraints restricting where new persistent volumes should be created. Currently, it is only possible to constrain the path of the disk resource by regular expression.

profileName.description: The storage volume profile. Only volumes with the specified profile are used to launch an application. It this option is not given, any volume (with or without a profile) will be used for launching.

host_volume.description: A host volume is a directory on the local agent mapped to one in a container.

host_path.description: Path on the host filesystem to the location of the data you mounted

container_path.description: Path, in the container, where you wish to have the data mounted
